de.ur.iw.navigame.server

Class AppServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • de.ur.iw.navigame.utility.UnifiedServlet
          • de.ur.iw.navigame.server.AppServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig, javax.servlet.ServletContextListener

    @WebServlet(name="AppServlet")
public class AppServlet
extends UnifiedServlet
implements javax.servlet.ServletContextListener
    The AppServlet is the servlet class for this application and receives all API calls, which it distinguishes by the "method"-Parameter they must provide.
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • handleRequest

        protected void handleRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                      throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                             java.io.IOException
        Handles both GET and POST request (you could still make a distinction via request.getMethod()), via the UnifiedServlet Any request must have a ?method=ABC parameter. If the key ABC exists in requestHandlers, that handler will take care of the request.
        Specified by:
        handleRequest in class UnifiedServlet
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        java.io.IOException

      • buildErrorMessage

        private java.lang.String buildErrorMessage()
        Builds a message that tells the user which request handlers are available.
        Returns:
        a string containing a list of method-ids for which request handlers are registered to this servlet.

      • contextInitialized

        public void contextInitialized(javax.servlet.ServletContextEvent servletContextEvent)
        Automatically called when the Server is started. Request Handlers are registered here: API requests all come to the same URL and reach the AppServlet, but that only distributes it to the appropriate ServletRequestHandler that is responsible for the request. If a request looks like .../_api_url_?method=areas, then the request handler which is registered to the "areas"-Key will take care of it.
        Specified by:
        contextInitialized in interface javax.servlet.ServletContextListener

      • contextDestroyed

        public void contextDestroyed(javax.servlet.ServletContextEvent servletContextEvent)
        Automatically called when the Server is shut down.
        Specified by:
        contextDestroyed in interface javax.servlet.ServletContextListener
